sen.j: 脇坂 安元（わきざか やすもと、1584年4月14日（天正12年3月4日 (旧暦)） - 1654年1月21日（承応2年12月3日 (旧暦)））は、江戸時代初期の大名。
sen.e: Yasumoto WAKIZAKA (April 14, 1584 - January 21, 1654) was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) in the early Edo period.
Yasumoto WAKIZAKA (April 14, 1584 - January 21, 1654) was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) in the early Edo period.
Yasumoto WAKIZAKA (April 14, 1584 - January 21, 1654) was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) in the early Edo period.

sen.j: 伊予国大洲藩第2代藩主、のち信濃国信濃飯田藩初代藩主。
sen.e: He was the second lord of the Ozu Domain in Iyo Province and then became the first lord of the Shinano Iida Domain in Shinano Province.
He was the second lord of the Ozu Domain in Iyo Province and then became the first lord of the Shinano-Iida Domain in Shinano Province.
He was the second lord of the Ozu Domain in Iyo Province and then became the first lord of the Shinano-Iida Domain in Shinano Province.

sen.j: 龍野藩脇坂家2代。
sen.e: He was the second generation of the Wakisaka family in the Tatsuno Domain.
He was the second generation of the Wakizaka family in the Tatsuno Domain.
He was the second generation of the Wakizaka family in the Tatsuno Domain.

sen.j: 大洲藩初代藩主脇坂安治の次男。
sen.e: He was the second son of Yasuharu WAKIZAKA, the first lord of the Ozu Domain.
He was the second son of Yasuharu WAKIZAKA, the first lord of the Ozu Domain.
He was the second son of Yasuharu WAKIZAKA, the first lord of the Ozu Domain.

sen.j: 名は初め「亨（とおる）」。
sen.e: His first given name was "Toru."
His first given name was 'Toru.'
His first given name was 'Toru.'

sen.j: 通称甚太郎。
sen.e: He was known as Jintaro.
He was known as Jintaro.
He was known as Jintaro.

sen.j: 兄・脇坂安忠がいたが、若くして病没したために嫡子となる。
sen.e: Since his elder brother Yasutada WAKIZAKA died young of disease, he became the heir.
Since his older brother Yasutada WAKIZAKA died young of disease, he became the heir.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: Since his older brother Yasutada WAKIZAKA died young of disease, he became the heir.

sen.j: 弟に脇坂安信、脇坂安経など。
sen.e: He had younger brothers Yasunobu WAKISAKA and Yasutsune WAKIZAKA.
He had younger brothers Yasunobu WAKIZAKA and Yasutsune WAKIZAKA, and others.
He had younger brothers Yasunobu WAKIZAKA and Yasutsune WAKIZAKA, and others.

sen.j: 正室は石河光元の娘。
sen.e: His lawful wife was the daughter of Mitsumoto ISHIKAWA.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Mitsumoto ISHIKAWA.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Mitsumoto ISHIKAWA.

sen.j: 実子はなく、嫡養嗣子に下総国佐倉藩主堀田正盛の次男・脇坂安政。
sen.e: He did not have a biological child and accordingly adopted as an heir the second son of Masamori HOTTA, the lord of the Sakura Domain in Shimousa Province, and name him Yasumasa WAKIZAKA.
He did not have a biological child and accordingly adopted Yasumasa WAKIZAKA who was the second son of Masamori HOTTA, the lord of the Sakura Domain in Shimosa Province, as an heir.
He did not have a biological child and accordingly adopted Yasumasa WAKIZAKA who was the second son of Masamori HOTTA, the lord of the Sakura Domain in Shimosa Province, as an heir.

sen.j: 従五位下淡路守。
sen.e: He was awarded the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and held the title of Awaji no kami (the governor of Awaji Province).
He was awarded the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and held the title of Awaji no kami (Governor of Awaji Province).
He was awarded the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and held the title of Awaji no kami (Governor of Awaji Province).

sen.j: なお、安元には安政以前に養子（安経、脇坂安利）がいたがいずれも早世した。
sen.e: Incidentally, Yasumoto had adopted children (Yasutsune and Yasutoshi WAKIZAKA) before he adopted Yasumasa, but both of them died young.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Incidentally, Yasumoto had adopted children (Yasutsune and Yasutoshi WAKIZAKA) before he adopted Yasumasa, but both of them died young.
Incidentally, Yasumoto had adopted children (Yasutsune and Yasutoshi WAKIZAKA) before he adopted Yasumasa, but both of them died young.

sen.j: このため、当時の将軍徳川家光の信任が厚い堀田正盛の次男である安政を養子とすることを願い出て許されている。
sen.e: Therefore, he proposed to adopt Yasumasa, the second son of Masamori HOTTA, who was trusted by then-Shogun Iemitsu TOKUGAWA, and he got permission.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, he proposed to adopt Yasumasa, the second son of Masamori HOTTA, who was trusted by then-Shogun Iemitsu TOKUGAWA, and he got permission.
Therefore, he proposed to adopt Yasumasa, the second son of Masamori HOTTA, who was trusted by then-Shogun Iemitsu TOKUGAWA, and he got permission.

sen.j: これにより、外様の小藩であった脇坂家は譜代大名となることができた。
sen.e: Accordingly, the Wakisaka family, which was a small domain of tozama daimyo (nonhereditary feudal lord) could become a fudai daimyo (a daimyo in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family).
Accordingly, the Wakizaka family, which was a small domain of tozama daimyo (nonhereditary feudal lord) could become a fudai daimyo (a daimyo in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family).
Accordingly, the Wakizaka family, which was a small domain of tozama daimyo (nonhereditary feudal lord) could become a fudai daimyo (a daimyo in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family).

sen.j: 略歴
sen.e: Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History

sen.j: 関ヶ原の戦いには父安治と出陣。
sen.e: He went into the Battle of Sekigahara with his father Yasuharu.
He went into the Battle of Sekigahara with his father Yasuharu.
He went into the Battle of Sekigahara with his father Yasuharu.

sen.j: 戦後の佐和山城攻めにも加わり、大坂の役でも先鋒として活躍する。
sen.e: He also joined in the Battle of Sawayama-jo Castle after the war and then in the Osaka no Eki (The Siege of Osaka) as a spearhead.
He also joined in the attack of Sawayama-jo Castle after the war and then in the Osaka no Eki (The Siege of Osaka) as a spearhead.
He also joined in the attack of Sawayama-jo Castle after the war and then in the Osaka no Eki (The Siege of Osaka) as a spearhead.

sen.j: その後、父の隠居に伴い家督を継ぐ。
sen.e: After that, he succeeded the head of the family when his father retired from his position as head of the family.
After that, he succeeded the head of the family when his father retired from his position as head of the family.
After that, he succeeded the head of the family when his father retired from his position as head of the family.

sen.j: 伊予国大洲藩5万3千石から、信濃国信濃飯田藩5万5千石に加増移封された。
sen.e: He was transferred, ended up having an additional number of territories, from 53,000 koku of the Ozu Domain in Iyo Province to 55,000 koku of the Shinano Iida Domain in Shinano Province.
He was transferred, ended up having an additional number of territories, from 53,000 koku of the Ozu Domain in Iyo Province to 55,000 koku of the Shinano-Iida Domain in Shinano Province.
He was transferred, ended up having an additional number of territories, from 53,000 koku of the Ozu Domain in Iyo Province to 55,000 koku of the Shinano-Iida Domain in Shinano Province.

sen.j: 二代目安政と共に55年間に渡って飯田の城下町を整備し、飯田城の掘割を完成させた。
sen.e: For 55 years he maintained the castle town of Iida with Yasumasa, the second, and completed canals around Iida-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: For 55 years he maintained the castle town of Iida with Yasumasa, the second, and completed canals around Iida-jo Castle.
For 55 years he maintained the castle town of Iida with Yasumasa, the second, and completed canals around Iida-jo Castle.

sen.j: 街道の流通と伝馬を確立し、飯田十八町を完成させ、文化産業振興にも力を注ぐなど、飯田の発展に尽くした。
sen.e: He contributed to the development of Iida by establishing the distribution and post-horse system on the road, completing the Iida Juhachi-cho town, and focusing also on promotion of cultural business.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He contributed to the development of Iida by establishing the distribution and post-horse system on the road, completing the Iida Juhachi-cho (飯田十八町, 18 towns of Ida), and focusing also on promotion of cultural business.
sen.cmt: 「飯田十八町」の意味が確認できませんでしたので、念のため漢字補足しました。
sen.e: He contributed to the development of Iida by establishing the distribution and post-horse system on the road, completing the Iida Juhachi-cho (飯田十八町, 18 towns of Ida), and focusing also on promotion of cultural business.

sen.j: 後に朝鮮通信使の江戸接待役や下館城守衛などを務めるなど活躍した。
sen.e: After that, he served as a Edo marshal for Chosen Tsushinshi (the Korean Emissary) and a guard of Shimodate-jo Castle.
After that, he served as an Edo marshal for Chosen Tsushinshi (the Korean Emissary) and a guard of Shimodate-jo Castle.
After that, he served as an Edo marshal for Chosen Tsushinshi (the Korean Emissary) and a guard of Shimodate-jo Castle.

sen.j: 承応2年（1653年）12月3日、70歳で死去した。
sen.e: He died at the age of 70 on January 21, 1654.
He died at the age of 70 on January 21, 1654.
He died at the age of 70 on January 21, 1654.

sen.j: 法号：藤亭安元八雲院。
sen.e: His hogo (a Buddhist name) was Fujitei Yasumoto Yakumoin.
His hogo (a Buddhist name): Fujitei Yasumoto Yakumoin
His hogo (a Buddhist name): Fujitei Yasumoto Yakumoin

sen.j: 墓所：京都市右京区花園の妙心寺隣花院。
sen.e: His grave is located at Rinkain, Myoshin-ji Temple in Hanazono, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.
The location of his grave: Rinkain, Myoshin-ji Temple in Hanazono, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.
The location of his grave: Rinkain, Myoshin-ji Temple in Hanazono, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 教養人
sen.e: Educated person
Educated person
Educated person

sen.j: 安元は武家第一の歌人といわれ八雲軒と号した。
sen.e: Yasumoto called himself Yakumoken and was said to be the best poet among samurai families.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yasumoto called himself Yakumoken and was said to be the best poet among samurai families.
Yasumoto called himself Yakumoken and was said to be the best poet among samurai families.

sen.j: 徳川秀忠の談伴衆でもあった教養人で、和漢書籍数千巻を蔵していた。
sen.e: He was an educated person who served as Danbanshu for Hidetada TOKUGAWA and possessed several thousands of Japanese and Chinese books.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was an educated person who served as Danbanshu (談伴衆, executive adviser) for Hidetada TOKUGAWA and possessed several thousands of Japanese and Chinese books.
sen.cmt: 読み未確認の漢字および補足しました。
sen.e: He was an educated person who served as Danbanshu (談伴衆, executive adviser) for Hidetada TOKUGAWA and possessed several thousands of Japanese and Chinese books.

sen.j: 「下館日記」「在昔抄」など著作も多い。
sen.e: He also wrote many books, including "Shimodate Nikki" (diary of Shimodate) and "Zaisekisho" (collection of the past).
He also wrote many books, including 'Shimodate Nikki' (The Diary of Yasumoto WAKIZAKA) and 'Zaisekisho' (collection of the past).
He also wrote many books, including 'Shimodate Nikki' (The Diary of Yasumoto WAKIZAKA) and 'Zaisekisho' (collection of the past).

sen.j: 林羅山から儒学を学び、逆に歌道を教えるという師弟関係でもあった。
sen.e: He and Razan HAYASHI were a teacher-pupil relationship: he learned Confucianism from Razan and he taught Razan the art of versification.
He and Razan HAYASHI were a teacher-pupil relationship: He learned Confucianism from Razan and he taught Razan the art of versification.
He and Razan HAYASHI were a teacher-pupil relationship: He learned Confucianism from Razan and he taught Razan the art of versification.

sen.j: 安元の教養を知らしめる逸話として、以下のものがある。
sen.e: There is an anecdote to show how high Yasumoto's level of culture was:
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There is an anecdote to show how high Yasumoto's level of culture was as follows:
There is an anecdote to show how high Yasumoto's level of culture was as follows:

sen.j: 家光の治世「寛永諸家系図伝」が編纂されるにあたり、戦国時代に成り上がった大名諸家が源平藤橘などと名門の出であると取り繕った系図を競うように作った。
sen.e: When "Kanei shoka keizuden" (The Genealogies of the Houses of the Kanei Period) was compiled in the reign of Iemitsu, each daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) who rose to a greater prominence in the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) attempted to manipulate their genealogy to make it appear that they were from a noble family, such as the genpeitokitsu (shortened expression of four major families).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When 'Kanei shoka keizuden' (The Genealogies of the Houses of the Kanei era) was compiled in the reign of Iemitsu, each daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) who rose to a greater prominence in the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) attempted to manipulate their genealogy to make it appear that they were from a noble family, such as the genpeitokitsu (shortened expression of four major clans; Minamoto, Taira, Fujiwara, and Tachibana clans).

When 'Kanei shoka keizuden' (The Genealogies of the Houses of the Kanei era) was compiled in the reign of Iemitsu, each daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) who rose to a greater prominence in the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) attempted to manipulate their genealogy to make it appear that they were from a noble family, such as the genpeitokitsu (shortened expression of four major clans; Minamoto, Taira, Fujiwara, and Tachibana clans).

sen.j: その中で、安元は「祖先は藤原氏であるらしい」ということだけしか判らなかった。
sen.e: However, Yasumoto only found that "his ancestor was supposedly from the Fujiwara clan."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, Yasumoto only found that 'his ancestor was supposedly from the Fujiwara clan' in it.
However, Yasumoto only found that 'his ancestor was supposedly from the Fujiwara clan' in it.

sen.j: このため、祖父脇坂安明からの短い系図のみを作り、冒頭に「北南 それとも知らず この糸の ゆかりばかりの 末の藤原」（北家・南家ひいては京家、式家いずれかは判りませんが、父祖よりたまたま藤原氏の末裔を名乗っております）という和歌をしたためて提出したという。
sen.e: Therefore, he created only a short genealogy starting from his grandfather Yasuakira WAKIZAKA and submitted it with a waka poet on the top: "I do not know if my ancestor was from the Northern House or Southern House, or even Kyo Family or Shiki Family of the Fujiwara clan, but my grandfather began to identify himself as an ancestor of the Fujiwara clan as it happens."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, he created only a short genealogy starting from his grandfather Yasuakira WAKIZAKA and submitted it with a waka poet on the top: 'I do not know if my ancestor was from the Northern House or Southern House, or even the Capital House or the Ceremonial House of the Fujiwara clan, but my grandfather began to identify himself as an ancestor of the Fujiwara clan as it happens.'
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: Therefore, he created only a short genealogy starting from his grandfather Yasuakira WAKIZAKA and submitted it with a waka poet on the top: 'I do not know if my ancestor was from the Northern House or Southern House, or even the Capital House or the Ceremonial House of the Fujiwara clan, but my grandfather began to identify himself as an ancestor of the Fujiwara clan as it happens.'
